description: Coined in 1851 by Samuel A. Cartwright as a mental illness that caused black slaves to flee captivity. Ancient Greek δραπέτης (drapétēs, “runaway slave”) + μανία (manía, “madness”).

entries.meaning: The desire of slaves to run away, viewed as a mental illness.
(dated) an overwhelming urge to run away (from home, a bad situation, responsibility, etc.)
